Method Detail

getParameterNames

public static List<String> getParameterNames(String sql)
Gets an ArrayList that contains the parameters that are found in the specified SQL string.
The position of each parameter in the list is the same as its occurence in the SQL statement. Each parameters occurs in the list as many times as it is found in the SQL string. Parameters are strings starting with colon (:).

Parameters:
sql - String being parsed.
Returns:
Returns a list with the names of the parameters found in the specified SQL string.

namesToParametersList

public static List<Parameter> namesToParametersList(List<String> parmNames)
Creates an ArrayList Parameter objects from an ArrayList of parameter names.
Each parameter occurs in the same position as its name in the parmNames ArrayList

Parameters:
parmNames - ArrayList with parameter names.
Returns:
Returns a list of parameter objects.

toString

public static String toString(Object object)
Null safe toString.

Parameters:
object -
Returns:
If the object is null, returns the string literal null. Otherwise, returns the toString() value of the object.

toQuotedString

public static String toQuotedString(Object object)
Null safe toString.

Parameters:
object -
Returns:
If the object is null, returns the string literal null. Otherwise, returns the toString() value of the object in single quotes.

sqlString

public static String sqlString(Object object)
Creates the SQL string for the specified object.

Parameters:
object - Value to present as an SQL literal.
Returns:
Returns a string literal that represents the specified value in the SQL dialect.

replaceParametersWithMarkers

Parameters:

Returns:

createInFromCollection

public static String createInFromCollection(Collection<?> col,
                                            String column,
                                            boolean isNot,
                                            boolean addEnd)
This function gets a collection and creates and in or not in sql statement.
E.g. from the set {1,2,3} will create the statement "in (1,2,3)"

Parameters:
col - Collection to
column - the database column name.
isNot - create "not in" instead of "in".
addEnd - include "add" in the String.
Returns:
the formatted String to be added to the sql.
